channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The U.S. Has More Guns, But Russia Has More Murders
item.description: A prominent Russian lawmaker mocked the U.S. during the mass shooting in Washington this week. But statistics show that Russia has more killings each year than the U.S. despite a much smaller population.
item.content:encoded:
A prominent Russian lawmaker mocked the U.S. during the mass shooting in Washington this week. But statistics show that Russia has more killings each year than the U.S. despite a much smaller population.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: An Introduction To What's New And What's Next
item.description: The online magazine Ozy launched Monday, offering readers a streamlined site with original reporting and a look at trends on the horizon. Co-founder Carlos Watson talks about his vision for the site.
item.content:encoded:
The online magazine Ozy launched Monday, offering readers a streamlined site with original reporting and a look at trends on the horizon. Co-founder Carlos Watson talks about his vision for the site.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Attack In Nairobi Turns Mall Into A Battlefield
item.description: Gunmen attacked an upscale Mall in Nairobi Saturday, killing at least 30, according to the Red Cross. Kenyan forces have been fighting the gunmen who remain in the mall.
item.content:encoded:
Gunmen attacked an upscale Mall in Nairobi Saturday, killing at least 30, according to the Red Cross. Kenyan forces have been fighting the gunmen who remain in the mall.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: North Korea Cancels Plans For Cross-Border Family Reunions
item.description: A chance for families in South and North Korea to meet long-lost relatives has been put off, as North Korea canceled reunions that were to take place in the coming week. A South Korean official called the decision "inhumane" Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
A chance for families in South and North Korea to meet long-lost relatives has been put off, as North Korea canceled reunions that were to take place in the coming week. A South Korean official called the decision "inhumane" Saturday.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Bombings Kill Dozens Of Mourners At Baghdad Funeral
item.description: In Sadr City, a bombing attack has killed dozens of people, with the death toll continuing to rise Saturday. Multiple reports are citing at least 65 deaths in the attack, one of several in Iraq today.
item.content:encoded:
In Sadr City, a bombing attack has killed dozens of people, with the death toll continuing to rise Saturday. Multiple reports are citing at least 65 deaths in the attack, one of several in Iraq today.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Syria Meets Deadline On Chemical Weapons; Fighting Continues
item.description: Syria has delivered data about its arsenal of chemical weapons, meeting a deadline set by the U.S. and Russia a week ago. But the country's civil war is continuing.
item.content:encoded:
Syria has delivered data about its arsenal of chemical weapons, meeting a deadline set by the U.S. and Russia a week ago. But the country's civil war is continuing.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Gunmen Use Grenades In Deadly Attack At Upscale Nairobi Mall
item.description: Shoppers at the upscale Westgate Mall came under assault by gunfire and grenades around lunch hour in Nairobi. At least 39 people have died, says Kenya's president, including members of his own family.
item.content:encoded:
Shoppers at the upscale Westgate Mall came under assault by gunfire and grenades around lunch hour in Nairobi. At least 39 people have died, says Kenya's president, including members of his own family.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Syria Agreement Makes For Unstable Alliances
item.description: As Syria turns over its "initial declaration" of chemical weapons, President Bashar Assad and Russian President Vladimir Putin have become partners with the U.S., argues Jeffrey Goldberg of The Atlantic. Host Scott Simon talks to Goldberg about the foreign affairs strategy with Syria.
item.content:encoded:
As Syria turns over its "initial declaration" of chemical weapons, President Bashar Assad and Russian President Vladimir Putin have become partners with the U.S., argues Jeffrey Goldberg of The Atlantic. Host Scott Simon talks to Goldberg about the foreign affairs strategy with Syria.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Germany, Lauded For Welcoming Gays, Lags In Granting Rights
item.description: Germany's government has not legalized gay marriage or adoption, a position that could cost it votes in Sunday's election.
item.content:encoded:
Germany's government has not legalized gay marriage or adoption, a position that could cost it votes in Sunday's election.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Gunmen Attack Upscale Nairobi Shopping Mall
item.description: The police chief said officers are on the ground now engaging the attackers. He said the men were trying to rob a shop within the mall.
item.content:encoded:
The police chief said officers are on the ground now engaging the attackers. He said the men were trying to rob a shop within the mall.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: The Effects Of The Snowden Leaks Aren't What He Intended
item.description: Critics of the NSA's secret surveillance hoped the debate that followed Edward Snowden's leaks would prompt the NSA to rethink the operation. Instead, one of the most noticeable effects so far has been a diversion of resources away from intelligence missions toward assessing damage from the leaks.
item.content:encoded:
Critics of the NSA's secret surveillance hoped the debate that followed Edward Snowden's leaks would prompt the NSA to rethink the operation. Instead, one of the most noticeable effects so far has been a diversion of resources away from intelligence missions toward assessing damage from the leaks.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: All Across Brazil, The Art Scene Is Shifting
item.description: Not only are Brazilian artists now getting big play in major museums around the world, but something new is happening inside Brazil: There's a burgeoning appetite for art.
item.content:encoded:
Not only are Brazilian artists now getting big play in major museums around the world, but something new is happening inside Brazil: There's a burgeoning appetite for art.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Will The U.S. Grant A Visa To Sudan's Indicted Leader?
item.description: The U.S. is supposed to allow everyone to come to the annual United Nations General Assembly, which opens next week. But Washington has yet to rule on the visa application by Omar al-Bashir, the Sudanese president who's been indicted on genocide charges by the International Criminal Court.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. is supposed to allow everyone to come to the annual United Nations General Assembly, which opens next week. But Washington has yet to rule on the visa application by Omar al-Bashir, the Sudanese president who's been indicted on genocide charges by the International Criminal Court.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Powerful Typhoon Has Hong Kong In Its Sights
item.description: The storm, which packed winds of 150 mph on Friday, is expected to weaken before it hits the Chinese territory.
item.content:encoded:
The storm, which packed winds of 150 mph on Friday, is expected to weaken before it hits the Chinese territory.

item.title: In First Step, Syria Outlines Chemical Weapons Program
item.description: An international watchdog based in the Netherlands says it has received an "initial declaration" of chemical weapons from Damascus.
item.content:encoded:
An international watchdog based in the Netherlands says it has received an "initial declaration" of chemical weapons from Damascus.
